content: Meta fittixna summer job, la jien u lanqas shabi ma stajna nsibu xogħol b'iżjed minn 4 e is-siegħa (illegali li tħallas b'inqas mill-minimum wage).  Is-summer jobs tal-iskema tal-gvern farsa sħiħa. bażikament jibgħatuk f'post bla ac fejn tagħmel jumejn tipprova ssib x'inhu xogħlok għax ħadd ma jkun ippreparat li ġejjin l-istudenti. Xħin jindunaw li bagħtulhom studenta,  tispiċċa jew taħli l-ħin jew titgħabba bix-xogħol ta' xi ħaddiem li jħallik tinqela bil-filing u hu jiġri barra.  Inkella jibgħatuk tgħallem is-summer school - tliet persuni ta' 17, bla kwalifikazzjonijiet pedagoġiċi u b'responsabilta' enormi li jieħdu ħsieb madwar 15-il tifel u tifla...  S'issa kont fortunata li ta' 16 ilni naħdem mindu kelli 14 fit-turiżmu... U xorta bqajt nitħallas kważi xejn minkejja li għandi esperjenza vasta u nitkellem tajjeb erba' lingwi :/.  Min naħa l-oħra ma tagħtix tort lill-employers diċenti - ftit minnhom lesti li joffru training għall-ħaddiema li lesti biss għal xahrejn ta' sigħat flessibli fis-sajf :/.

It's a foolish system. Third country nationals accept being paid peanuts because they likely make far less in their home countries, which sets a new standard for employers. That standard is IMPOSSIBLE to fix from a mindset perspective, because "It's been this way for a long time" is tantamount to written legal law for the Maltese.  If that standard ever improves, business owners will cry about the end of the world because "my profits are down by 300%!", even if the truth is just the status quo going back to pre-"fuck me in the ass" levels (a real financial term I just created).  Don't blame people for not accepting that horseshit. What's unfortunate is that you hear people going "madonna kemm ghawn barranin!" when they themselves created the issue.

Nahdem p/t ma ristorant, gili ghamilt il-pre-interview nghidulu, incempel/nibghat email lill-min japplika.   Minn l-ahhar batch ta 50 persuna ghal waiter li applikaw, 24 maltin, 26 barranin.   Grupp minnhom available all days, u lesti jaghmlu xoghol "zejjed" tipo jahslu platti jekk jkun hemm bzonn (bl-istess paga ta waiter u bid-dishwasher) u li hemm bzonn. Imxew ghal interview 16.   grupp iehor, ghax jien vegan ma mmissx platti bil-laham, ghax sibtijiet ma nahdimx, ghax il-boghod (15-20 minutes karozza matul il-gurnata, ahseb u ara filghaxija xhin tlesti biex tmur lura), ma nahsilx platti. Iehor kull data li offrejtlu ghal interview, kelli 3, ma nistax, ma nistax, ma nistax - kompli pappija mal-jobsplus mela, ohrajn b'kazijiet il-qorti ghadhom ghaddejin inkluz glied/serq etc - marridx trouble, -  5 ha jimxu ghal interview.  ​. > What is fucking you up are the over paid foreigners.  Who exactly are you referring to?  Personally, I don't see how "overpaid foreigners" are fucking anyone up. What I do see is increasing income disparity. But the reason why some foreigners are able to command high salaries (compared to local salaries, not necessarily international ones - let's say 80k+) is that they are capable of performing specialized work for which the small local market does not have enough qualified talent. Local companies then have to recruit abroad, sometimes even going through the process of relocating TCNs. Again, not to save money, as recruitment/relocation/visa make the process quite costly, but simply because they just cannot find qualified workers in Malta. Of course these foreigners are able to spend more, but without them, their companies - many of which employ hundreds of Maltese - would simply cease to exist, at least in Malta.
